Pizza Dough

Quick pizza dough using baking powder for same-day use. Creates 3 individual pizzas with par-baked crusts.

Yield: 3 pizza crusts

pizza

Ingredients

  • 3 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • 3 tbsp olive oil
  • 1.5 tsp agave
  • 1.25 cup water (divided)

Procedure

Making the Dough

  1. Place pizza stone in oven and preheat to 425Â°F
  2. Combine all dry ingredients in a large bowl
  3. In a separate bowl, combine agave, olive oil, and 3/4 cup water
  4. Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients and combine
  5. Add remaining water as needed to get a tacky dough
  6. Divide into 3 equal balls
  7. Let stand 15-20 minutes to relax

Par-baking

  1. Roll out each ball of dough to desired thickness
  2. Cook on pizza stone 3-4 minutes per side until golden-ish
  3. Lance any bubbles with a fork if needed while par-baking

Final Assembly and Baking

  1. Top par-baked pizzas with desired toppings
  2. Place back on pizza stone for 10-ish minutes or until crust reaches desired doneness and toppings are cooked through
